channel.name: Straight Razor (Hermit relic) - Daily Discussion 9 Feb

messages.content: Previous Daily Discussion: #deleted-channel

Next Daily Discussion: #deleted-channel

__Votes__:
Sigil of Victory (Champ card): 1
Ring of the Snek (Snecko relic): 2
Mob Leader's Crown (Gremlins relic): 5
Daily Discussion 113/782

embeds.title: Straight Razor
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / The Hermit / Downfall

Whenever you remove or **Transform** a card from your deck, heal 15 HP.
*For a cleaner shave...*

messages.content:
it uh
exists ig
probably a little stronger than basegame’s

embeds.title: Meal Ticket
embeds.description:
Common Relic / All / Slay the Spire

Whenever you enter a shop, heal 15 HP.
*"Complimentary meatballs with every visit!"*

messages.content: i probably wouldn’t buy it tho
i prefer meal ticket
a little worse, but more consistent
i mean 90% of times when I hit a shop  in act 2/3 I buy a remove
exceptions being if I ran out of gold or have

embeds.title: Maw Bank
embeds.description:
Common Relic / All / Slay the Spire

Whenever you climb a floor, gain 12 Gold :p_gold:. No longer works when you spend any Gold :p_gold: at a shop.
*Surprisingly popular, despite maw attacks being a regular occurrence.*

messages.content: yeah i suppose
not really much to say here tbh
healing relics other than IC all pale in comparison to <meat on the bone> anyway

embeds.title: Meat on the Bone
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Slay the Spire

If your HP is at or below 50% at the end of combat, heal 12 HP.
*The meat keeps replenishing, never seeming to fully run out.*

messages.content: but still, 75+ gold for 15 hp, or 15hp for free
with the occasiaonal event remove/transform giving a lil extra
i like <pantograph> tbh
great for heart runs, decent for everything else, lets you need to rest less before bosses

embeds.title: Pantograph
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Slay the Spire

At the start of Boss combats, heal 25 HP.
*"Solid foundations are not accidental. Tools for planning are a must." - The Architect*

messages.content: fair but impact of meat on the bone is generally both greater and allows you to never worry about attrition
I *might* buy pantograph but I would *definitely* buy meat on the bone unless my deck was so strong that it would not matter or it was act4 already
yk fair,
why does hermit have a razor anyways
relics pretty mid, its like meal ticket but you need to have gold to remove. Sometimes you can get an extra heal from an event but its unreliable
hermit also pay not even want to remove strikes/defend if you have his cards that directly synergies with them. Which can make this relic do nothing
unless your defends have a key synergy with a high noon you've picked, you have no reason to keep them and i imagine hermit in general gets rid of them before strikes
unless i have strike synergy I delete strikes a lot tbh
you also have an easier time picking curses from events when you otherwise wouldn't and gain hp from their removal
i remove defends if I have <showdown> I suppose

embeds.title: Showdown
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

**Retain**.
Deal 8 (13) damage.
Play all Strikes in your hand.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: hermit also in general bleeds hp through rugged, overwhelming power or cursed weapon, so a heal relic feels somewhat appropriate
but even if I have <maintenance> I would rather just use it for the dex unless my deck already goes hard into strike build

embeds.title: Maintenance
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

*Strikes deal 3 (4) more damage this combat.
Gain 1 (2) **Dexterity** :p_dexterity:.
This costs 1 more this combat.

messages.content: hmm, maybe meintenance should buff strikes harder after all
i remember old maintenance

maintenance alone isn’t enough because strike build lacks draw and manip mostly, and you need cost manip like <cheat> or <lone wolf> to keep scaling
if i got maintenance early and like 2-3 strike build cards I would probably take <high noon> from act 1 boss rare though

embeds.title: Cheat
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

Play one of the top 3 (5) cards in your draw pile.
**Dead On:** Also trigger its **Dead On** effect.

embeds.title: Lone Wolf
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 (0) :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

Choose a card.
It costs 0 this turn.
Discard the rest of your hand.

embeds.title: High Noon
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 2 (1) :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

Whenever you play a Strike or Defend, draw a card.

messages.content: So, kinda weird relic, I almost feel like it would work better if it provided a card removal by itself, with smaller Heal if any.
Maybe, though I think neither is really perfect.
It would make it a lot less interactive.
~~well if you subscribe to the cat hermit mod~~

I think this relic is really solid, and it's one I would like to see made available to all characters. It encourages card removal (positive reinforcement of something you already want to do), and provides sustain throughout a run, making cards like cursed weapon and overwhelming power less painful, and making coffee dripper a more reasonable boss relic.

There are a reasonably large number of events that offer card removes and transforms, you can't guarantee them, but I think you are likely to get 2-3 opportunities over the course of most runs. It is very similar to meal ticket at shops, but I really don't mind paying for a card remove, that's very likely one of the best ways to spend gold anyways. Having the extra sustain is great to let you take more aggressive paths with extra elites and can cover for unfortunate turns where you draw poorly. Perhaps I just like all sustain relics more than average, but I think this one is quite solid.
You can also see this at a shop, buy it, then card remove at the same shop and immediately heal 15 health. Gets better with courier, smiling mask, and membership card.
